result.execSummary:
The defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations placed on a payment plan $20 a month beginning 3/28/2017
Obtain and maintain at least half-time employment.
Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
NO CONTACT JASMINE CONNORS
NO CONTACT JONATHON CONNORS
NO CONTACT WITH ASHLAND WALMART
NO CONTACT WITH RENO TORGERSON 
NO CONTACT WITH BONNIE CLAREMBOUX
Not to associate with any known herion or methamphetamine user except for purposes of counseling and/or treatment. 
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF157 and 16CF163 prelim hearing scheduled, Atty Rafferty waives prelim, wants to proceed to sentencing. Information filed, Atty Rafferty waives reading. 
Written offer to settle sets for the entire agreement of the parties. Charges and penalties read. Plea NC to 13 counts. Admits repeater. 
16cts DRI, Ct also notes uncharged offense.
Ct accepts pleas and finds def guilty. 
State has complied with vic rights.  Ct is not sure if will accept agreement of the parties. Ct questions. Parties comments on sentencing. Sentence entered as proposed in offer to settle (attached). PRH scheduled to file FDS. 
  Probation review hearing scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 08:00 am.
